pull.title: test: Add remaining scenarios of 0 waste, in wallet waste_test
pull.body:
As per the [review club](https://bitcoincore.reviews/22009) discussion on #22009 , it was observed that there were other two fee scenarios in which selection waste could be zero.

These are:
 - (LTF - Fee) == Change Cost
 - (LTF - Fee) == Excess

Even though these are obvious by the definition of waste metric, adding tests for them can be helpful in explaining its behavior
to new readers of the code base, along with pinning the behavior for future.

This PR adds those two cases to waste calculation unit test.

Also let me know if I am missing more scenarios.

events.body:
Concept ACK

> These are:
> 
>     * (Fee - LTF) == Change Cost
> 
>     * (Fee - LTF) == Excess

Strictly speaking it should be: 
   * (Fee - LTF) + Change Cost = 0  
      ⇒ (Fee - LTF) == -1×Change Cost  

   * (Fee - LTF) + Excess = 0
     ⇒ (Fee - LTF) == -1×Excess
Left a nit on the comment explaining the test

Thanks @Xekyo for the review and agreed. It should be reversed. 

Updated everywhere..

ACK 0ce33016eb905f5ac3709ed95ae02db0f97885a2

Perhaps update the commit message and pull description with @Xekyo's calculations in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22938#issuecomment-916948224. Edit: never mind, it seems fine now IIUC.

Thanks @jonatack for the review. Those were good suggestions.

Updated the comment description.
Updated commit message.
Updated with braced initialization.

Code review re-ACK a2a9c23e261ad88c0133b407c6e1b4c54f90a860 per `git diff 0ce3301 a2a9c23`


Sub-atomic consistency nits, but definitely ignore unless you have to rebase or something (and maybe even then).

test: Add remaining scenarios of 0 waste

There are two more cases where waste can be 0, when:
 - (Fee - LTF) == -Change Cost
 - (Fee - LTF) == -Excess

Adding these two conditions explicitly in the unit test will help
pin the behavior, also demonstrate waste calculation scenarios to new
readers.

events.body: @jonatack Sorry for my silly overlooks.. Updated now only..

comments.body:
```suggestion
    // 0 Waste when (long term fee - fee) == cost of change, and no excess
```
As it is currently written the two aren't equal but negatives of each other.

```suggestion
    // 0 Waste when (long term fee - fee) == excess, no change cost
```
Same here.

only because your other calculations are in this order
```suggestion
    const CAmount exact_target{in_amt - fee * 2};
```
